fallow.translation[0].definitions[0].def: fallow land is dug or ploughed but is not used for growing crops
fallow.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: They let the land lie fallow for a year.
fallow.translation[1].definitions[0].def: fallow land has been dug but is not being used for growing crops, giving the quality of the soil a chance to improve
fallow.translation[1].definitions[1].def: if land lies fallow, it is not being used to grow crops
fallow.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The EU introduced incentives for farmers to let land lie fallow in order to reduce grain surpluses.
fallow.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a fallow period of time for a person or organization is one when they are not very active, productive, profitable etc
fallow.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The pharmaceutical division emerged from a relatively fallow period, with increased profits this year.
